definitions.definition: To show up; to appear suddenly or unexpectedly.
definitions.example: I don't like people turning up without an appointment.

definitions.definition: To cause to appear; to find by searching, etc.
definitions.example: I spent hours in the archives, but couldn't turn up anything on the alleged criminal.

definitions.definition: To increase the amount of something by means of a control, such as the volume, heat, or light.
definitions.example: Turn up the radio and sing along.

definitions.definition: To reposition by rotating, flipping, etc. upwards.
definitions.example: He turned up his collar against the cold.

definitions.definition: To belay or make fast a line on a cleat or pin.
To party hard, especially when involving alcohol or drugs.
definitions.example: We're going to turn up at the concert tonight.

definitions.definition: Fabric turned up at the bottom of trousers to make them shorter.
definitions.example: Why does all this fluff acumulate in the turn-ups?

definitions.definition: The next card taken from the top of a pack of cards and displayed.
definitions.example: I'll bet $10 that the next turn-up is an ace.

definitions.definition: A stroke of good luck; something that appears unexpectedly; especially in turn up for the book.
